intro: Acourtia michoacana, commonly known as the Michoacan acourtia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico, specifically the state of Michoacan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
